displayName: Ensure third party integrated applications are not allowed
description: Third-party integrated applications connection to services should be disabled unless there is a very clear value and robust security controls are in place. Attackers can grant access from breached accounts to third party applications to exfiltrate data from your tenancy without having to maintain the breached account.
rationale: Disabling third-party integrated applications reduces the risk of data exfiltration and unauthorized access.
impact: End users will not be able to integrate third-party applications unless explicitly allowed by administrators.

remediation.text:
To remediate using the UI:
1. Navigate to Microsoft Entra admin center https://entra.microsoft.com/.
2. Click to expand Identity > Users select Users settings.
3. Set Users can register applications to No.
4. Click Save.

To remediate using PowerShell:
1. Connect to Microsoft Graph using Connect-MgGraph -Scopes 'Policy.ReadWrite.Authorization'
2. Run the following commands:
   $param = @{ AllowedToCreateApps = "$false" }
   Update-MgPolicyAuthorizationPolicy -DefaultUserRolePermissions $param

status.message: Users are allowed to register third-party applications.

notes: This control is equivalent to 5.1.2.2 in CIS 5.0.0.
